channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Is Rent-to-Own the Easiest and Most “Passive” Way to Scale Your Portfolio?
item.description: Do you have a cash flow problem? Maybe property management fees are setting you back, or you’re spending too much on repairs and maintenance. Today, we’re bringing you a powerful […]

item.title: CoinDCX acquires BitOasis in international expansion push
item.description: CoinDCX, India’s leading cryptocurrency exchange, is expanding internationally through the acquisition of BitOasis, a digital asset platform in the Middle East and North Africa, the companies said Wednesday. The Bengaluru-based startup said BitOasis’s team is joining CoinDCX, with the original leadership continuing to manage the exchange, which offers trading in more than 60 tokens. BitOasis […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Crime Rates and the 2024 Election: What You Need to Know
item.description: As crime data again becomes a flashpoint in the presidential campaign, experts push for better national statistics.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: How Military Members Can Use Real Estate Investing to Fast-Track Their Financial Freedom
item.description: Military real estate investing is perhaps the easiest way for veterans to reach financial freedom. Today’s guest is a prime example, going from broke recruiter to “military millionaire” in just […]

item.title: In a major update, Proton adds privacy-safe document collaboration to Drive, its freemium E2EE cloud storage service
item.description: Collaborative document features are being made available inside Proton Drive, further extending the company's trademark pitch of robust security. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Death Row Prisoner’s Parting Interview
item.description: Days before his scheduled execution in Texas, Ramiro Gonzales speaks on faith, legacy — and apologizing to the family of his victim, Bridget Townsend.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: 5 Things College Students Can Do Right Now To Reach Financial Freedom Faster
item.description: Whether you're a student or have kids about to enroll, these tips provide a great start to the financial independence journey.

item.title: Telegram lets creators share paid content to channels
item.description: Telegram launched a digital currency called Stars for in-app use last month. Now, the company is expanding its use cases to paid content. The chat app is also allowing channels to covert the stars they have to Toncoin — the cryptocurrency Telegram uses over The Open Network (TON) blockchain. Alternatively, they can use them to […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The New Battle Over an Old Institution: Forced Prison Labor
item.description: Inside the latest legal and legislative efforts to close state constitutional loopholes that allow slavery as punishment for a crime.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: Seeing Greene: Investing with High Rates, Recession Prepping, & RVs vs. ADUs
item.description: High interest rates are stopping you from investing, so what do you do? Wondering how to prepare for a recession if one hits soon? Should you sell your rentals and […]

item.title: Altrove uses AI models and lab automation to create new materials
item.description: For the past couple of years, innovation has been accelerating in new materials development. And a new French startup called Altrove plans to play a role in this innovation cycle. The deep tech startup has already raised €3.7 million (around $4 million at current exchange rates). If you’re interested in new materials development, you may […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mississippi Wants to Allow Some Votes From Jails and Prisons. Red Tape May Stop It.
item.description: A new state law will allow more people in jails and prisons to cast absentee ballots, but many obstacles remain.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: DIY Finance Friday: How to Create a Customized Path to Financial Independence
item.description: Want a personalized financial independence plan that’ll get you closer to early retirement? Well, we’ve got just what you’re looking for! On this second annual “Financial Independence Day,” Mindy and […]

item.title: Indian social network Koo is shutting down as buyout talks collapse
item.description: The Indian social media platform Koo, which positioned itself as a competitor to Elon Musk’s X, is ceasing operations after its last-resort acquisition talks with Dailyhunt collapsed. Despite securing over $60 million in funding from prominent investors including Tiger Global and Accel, Koo faced significant challenges in expanding its user base and generating revenue over […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Minneapolis Cop Who Beat Him Pleaded Guilty. He Still Fears the Department Won’t Change.
item.description: Jaleel Stallings was swept up in the chaos of protests over George Floyd’s murder. The outcome changed his life.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
